results.title: On the waterfront [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan, Sam Spiegel and Columbia
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Hoboken, New Jersey, Kazan’s film deals with trade unionism, corruption and racketeering on New York’s docks. Marlon Brando is cast as an ex-boxer who unknowingly lures a worker, planning to testify against the waterside union, to his death. His conscience drives him to redeem himself by exposing the corruption within the union hierarchy headed by Lee J. Cobb. Karl Malden and Eva Marie Saint provide the emotional and spiritual support that drive Brando to persevere in his struggle to eradicate organised crime on the waterfront and to uphold a workers right to work. Rod Steiger appears as Brando’s brother, torn between his family loyalty and loyalty to his union boss. Screenplay by Budd Schulbert based on articles by Malcolm Johnson. Photographed by Boris Kaufman. Music by Leonard Bernstein. Edited by Gene Milford. (Academy awards: Best picture, Best actor, Best supporting actress, Best cinematography, Best art direction, Best directing, Best film editing, Best screenplay)

results.brief_description: “Summary: this film aims to give the student an intuitive feel for the geometry of surfaces and examines the problem of finding local maxima and minima of a function of two variables”

results.title: On the side of the angels
results.creator_credit: Claire Jager, Peter Kaufmann and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: This film presents the story of the people involved in the movement for peace in Australia from 1900 to the present. Using rare archival film, the program reflects on the international events that concerned and influenced many people to organise together for peace and world stability. Features Ralph Gibson, founding member against war and fascism in the 30s, Stephen Murray-Smith, peace historian, Sam Goldbloom, Council for International Cooperation and Disarmament, Jim Cairns, Deputy Prime Minister with the Whitlam government, Jean McLean, radical Victorian Labour MP and Jo Camilleri, Convenor of People for Nuclear Disarmament.

results.title: On the outer
results.creator_credit: Russell Toose and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Investigates the plight of two of Sydney’s homeless men - one a widower in his sixties, the other a young man in his twenties - against a background of their fellow homeless people and the hostels where they live. Reporter: Richard Oxenburgh. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: On the loose: three stories about leaving school
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Lyn Norfor and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A trilogy about three teenagers seeking their independence in the outside world after finishing school. The three stories show the problems faced by a generation leaving school in the mid 1980s - boredom with school (“Exit Eddie Leech”), sexual pressures in the workplace (“Ring of Confidence”), and keeping a job (“Beginner’s luck”).

results.title: On the inside
results.creator_credit: Michael Adams and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound Training School and its effect on the student’s personality through the four-week course and its new and exciting experiences. The commentary consists mainly of the students’ own thoughts and words as they react to the many physical and mental challenges that they encounter during a course, giving them a deeper understanding of themselves and others.

results.title: On the highway
results.brief_description: Long distance driving on highways needs extra care. David Mackay, a prominent racing driver explains techniques and adds a few tips of his own. Begins with images of the Southern Aurora train as it speeds through the countryside approaching Sydney.

results.title: On the gunline
results.creator_credit: Department of the Navy and Supreme Films
results.brief_description: The Australian guided missile destroyer HMAS Perth at war in Vietnam. Shows the routine of war for the officers and men, self maintenance and preparations at the U.S. Navy base at Subic Bay in the Philippines, underway replenishment of fuel and ammunition and action on the gunline off South Vietnam.

results.title: On the edge of the forest
results.brief_description: Dr E F Schumacher the noted author of the book ‘Small is Beautiful’, describes in clear, elegant and incisive English what man is doing to the forests of southwest Western Australia. Stresses the need for conservation of the Jarrah and Karri forests in order to preserve the unique natural eco-system.
